archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.name: Operational Model: Data Center View Detail
archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.documentation:
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/reference_architectures/2017/html-single/deploying_and_managing_openshift_container_platform_3.6_on_amazon_web_services/
Hosts 1 baston (t2.micro) 3 OCP master (no cost with OCP, m4.xlarge) 3 OCP infrastructure (no cost with OCP, m4.xlarge) 6 OCP application (12 cores of OCP, t2.large) 6 Cloudforms (no cost with OCP, m4.xlarge) 3 Storage (i3.xlarge) 6 Ansible Tower (m4.xlarge) 3 Satellite (i3.xlarge) == Lab -> 25 "infastructure" hosts to support OCP + 6 OCP application hosts = 31 hosts Non production -> 25 "infastructure" hosts to support OCP + 6 OCP application hosts = 31 hosts Production with DR -> 25 "infastructure" hosts to support OCP + 6 OCP application hosts + 3 additional storage (another AWS region, other public cloud or on premises data center) + 1 Ansible Tower DR + 1 Satellite Server = 36 hosts
AWS VPC Networking Refer to reference architecture. More may be needed for Ansible, Cloudforms, Red Hat Storage and Red Hat Satellite.
AWS Security Group Refer to reference architecture. More may be needed for Ansible, Cloudforms, Red Hat Storage and Red Hat Satellite.

children.content: All OCP master, OCP infrastructure and OCP application nodes have network connectivity between each other.
Public IPs are assigned to restricted to key entry points.

Cloud Native Architecture based off of Red Hat OpenShift AWS Reference Architecture.
The toplogy used in this architecture consists of a single Red Hat OpenShift instance deployed in a single region with master and infrastructure nodes spread across 3 availability zones for resilience.
When in disaster recovery, the master's node data (script), external certificates (scripts), AWS objects (scripts), storage (RH Storage) needs to be exported to another region. Red Hat Cloudforms and Red Hat Ansible automation scripts can help with cold or warm DR.
Data will be replicated peer to peer by RH Storage. When more capacity or performance is needed, we can up the EC2 instance type or draw on more storage via AWS EBS.
Currently do no foresee AWS EBS and S3 usage. All storage is coming from the storage optimized EC2 instance (local attached SSD) running Red Hat Storage.
OCP master and OCP infrastructure Nodes are m4.xlarge (4 vCPU, 16gb mem).

Application container are t2.large (2 vCPU, 8gb mem). With 6 nodes, you have a total capacity of 48gb. Most containers are 2gb therefore 24 containers can be moving across 3 zones.
Application containers can be used to host applications, building new containers, Jenkins server (CI/CD), the aggregated logging stack (EFK), JBoss middleware, databases and any other docker based containers.
Used for executing disaster recovery and other automation scripts. Ansible Tower instances are m4.xlarge (4 vCPU, 16gb mem). Future: Containerization.
Satellite Capsule instances are i3.xlarge (4 vCPU, 30.5gb mem, 1tb SSD) storage optimized.
Red Hat Insights installed on all hosts.
Cloudforms instances are m4.xlarge (4 vCPU, 16gb mem). Future: Containerization.
Storage instances are i3.xlarge (4 vCPU, 30.5gb mem, 1tb SSD) storage optimized. Storage is physically attached SSD.
To replicate data off region for disaster recovery, there is a group of 3 Red Hat Storage servers somewhere else (other AWS region, other public cloud or on premises data center).
OCP master nodes are replicas of each other and are synced via peer to peer.
VPN connection between remote data center and AWS.
Generally speaking, each Cloudforms instance can support 400 EC2 instances.
Generally speaking, each RH Storage host can support 400 client connections.
